semantic_identifier: 106: feat: Priority scoring: quality-weighted & capped sales/opportunity signals with time decay

sections.text:
## Description

This PR updates the priority scoring model to prevent sales/opportunity linkage from disproportionately driving issue priority.

Changes:
- Introduces an opportunity quality score computed from opportunity attributes (e.g., stage, ARR magnitude bucket, and ICP fit). The sales/opportunity contribution is now proportional to this quality score rather than a flat boost.
- Adds exponential time decay to opportunity signals (based on opportunity last-updated/last-activity timestamp) so stale deal asks gradually lose influence.
- Applies a hard cap to the aggregated sales/opportunity contribution at the scoring level to ensure it cannot dominate the total issue score.
- Adds an evidence-aware cap: when support/customer evidence is sparse or missing, the sales/opportunity contribution is limited to not exceed the support/customer-evidence contribution (prevents high scores driven solely by sales linkage).

Implementation details:
- Refactors the scoring pipeline to compute `supportEvidenceScore` and `salesOpportunityScore` independently, then combines them with caps/guards applied before final normalization.
- Adds configurable parameters for quality weighting, decay half-life, and max sales contribution (with sensible defaults) to keep tuning easy without code changes.
- Updates unit tests/fixtures to cover: high-quality vs low-quality opportunities, stale vs recent opportunities, and scenarios with minimal support evidence to verify caps are enforced.

User impact:
- Issue priority will more closely track validated customer/support evidence while still reflecting sales impact for high-quality, active opportunities; older or low-quality opportunities will no longer keep issues artificially elevated.

## How Has This Been Tested?
